end.translation[0].definitions[0].defini: the last part of a period of time, event, activity, or story
end.translation[0].definitions[0].exampl: Hooker’s death marked the end of an era.
I played the tape from beginning to end.
Costs are expected to double by the end of 2012.
What would she find at the end of her journey?
end.translation[0].definitions[1].defini: a situation in which something is finished or no longer exists
end.translation[0].definitions[1].exampl: At last it seemed the war might be coming to an end.
The spacecraft is nearing the end of its useful life.
Well, I hope that’s the end of the matter.
Another year has passed, with no end in sight to the suffering.
It’s hoped the talks may bring an end to the violence.
The EU is demanding an end to the ivory trade.
call for/demand an end to something
He rose to indicate that the conversation was at an end.
end.translation[0].definitions[2].defini: the part of a place or object that is furthest from its beginning or centre
end.translation[0].definitions[2].exampl: The channel measures 20 feet from end to end.
He stood the box on end to open it.
We sat at opposite ends of the table.
He wore spectacles perched on the very end of his nose.
The end of the pencil snapped.
Jo joined the end of the line.
the far end (=furthest from you) of the room
end.translation[0].definitions[3].defini: one of the two points that begin or end a scale
end.translation[0].definitions[3].exampl: Some teenagers are just a nuisance, but at the other end of the scale there are kids who pose a real threat.
the cheaper end of the price range
At the opposite end of the political spectrum are the Marxist theories.
end.translation[0].definitions[4].defini: one of two places that are connected by a telephone call, journey etc
end.translation[0].definitions[4].exampl: We’ll get a bus connection at the other end.
Any problems at your end  (=where you are)?
Sometimes, all you need is a calm voice on the end of the phone.
end.translation[0].definitions[5].defini: a small piece of something that is left after you have finished with it
end.translation[0].definitions[6].defini: an aim or purpose, or the result you hope to achieve
end.translation[0].definitions[6].note.t: the end justifies the means (=used to say that doing bad things is acceptable if they achieve an important result)
end.translation[0].definitions[6].exampl: She’ll do anything to achieve her own ends.
Every task has a clear end in view.
40% of all research is undertaken for military ends.
He wants to cut costs, and to that end is looking at ways of cutting the company’s operations.
IT is a tool for learning, not merely an end in itself.
end.translation[0].definitions[7].defini: part of a job, activity, or situation that involves or affects one person or group of people
end.translation[0].definitions[7].exampl: She works in the sales end of things.
end.translation[0].definitions[8].defini: one of the two halves of a sports field
end.translation[0].definitions[9].defini: a word meaning death – used to avoid saying this directly
end.translation[0].definitions[9].exampl: He met his end (=died) in a car accident.
end.translation[0].note_box[0].heading: – Meaning 1: the last part of a period of time, event, activity, or story
end.translation[0].note_box[0].sections[: the end of the day/week/month etc
Karen’s returning to the States at the end of the month.
My licence runs out at the end of May.
The two men met once again before the end of the war.
be/mark the end of an era
The principal’s death marked the end of an era at the college.
Michael Jordon led the race from beginning to end.
end.translation[0].note_box[1].heading: – Meaning 2: a situation in which something is finished or no longer exists
end.translation[0].note_box[1].sections[: come to an end
Arsenal’s ten-match unbeaten run came to an end with a 3–2 defeat at United.
draw to an end
My holiday was drawing to an end.
get to/reach the end of something
The 40 year-old power station has now reached the end of its operating life.
put an end to something
A shoulder injury put an end to his baseball career.
bring an end to something/bring something to an end
They began peace talks aimed at bringing an end to the civil war.
call for/demand an end to something
The union is calling for an end to discrimination.
a sudden/abrupt end
After the news leaked out, his political career came to a sudden end.
an early end
Hopes of an early end to the conflict are fading.
a fitting end to something
The fireworks display was a fitting end to the celebrations.
the end of the matter
If you think that’s the end of the matter, you’re mistaken.
the end is in sight
After a three year wait, the end is finally in sight.
end.translation[0].note_box[2].heading: – Meaning 3: the part of a place or object that is furthest from its beginning or centre
end.translation[0].note_box[2].sections[: Jon and his girlfriend were sitting at the opposite end of the bar.
He walked to the far end of the room and sat at his desk.
The kids were splashing about in the shallow end.
The roof tiles are laid end to end.
end.translation[0].note_box[3].heading: – Meaning 8: part of a job, activity, or situation that involves or affects one person or group of people
end.translation[0].note_box[3].sections[: The government exploited the situation for political ends.
Some people would do almost anything to achieve their own ends.
Our first priority is safety, and the airline is working to that end.
The programme is not an end in itself, but rather the first step the prisoner takes towards a new life.
Their defence, that the end justifies the means, is not acceptable.
To Joe, work was a means to an end, nothing more.
We need to reduce costs, so with this end in view, the company is switching supplier.
end.translation[0].note_box[4].heading: GRAMMAR: Prepositions with end
You use at the end when talking about the last part of a story, book, film, game etc
At the end, the hero dies
There is a summary at the end of the chapter
You often use at the end of when talking about the last part of a period of time
Marco Polo travelled through Asia at the end of the 13th century
in the end of the 13th century
In the end means the same as ‘eventually’ You use it when saying that something happens or after a long period of time or a lot of other things have happened
In the end, she got her money back
I’m sure we’ll win in the end
end.translation[0].note_box[5].sections[: the part of a place or object that is furthest from the centre or the beginning
the end of something, especially something pointed
The point of the pencil broke.
end.translation[1].definitions[0].defini: if an event, activity, or story ends, it stops happening
end.translation[1].definitions[0].exampl: The festival will end with a spectacular laser show.
end.translation[1].definitions[1].exampl: The talks are aimed at ending the conflict.
end.translation[1].definitions[2].defini: to finish what you are doing
end.translation[1].definitions[2].exampl: I think we'll end there for today.
I’d like to end by inviting questions from the audience.
end.translation[1].definitions[3].defini: if a road, path, line etc ends, it reaches its final point
end.translation[1].definitions[3].exampl: This is where the line ends.
end.translation[1].definitions[4].defini: to reach the final point in a period of time in a particular condition
end.translation[1].definitions[4].exampl: They ended the game with a score of 63-42.
The company ended the year with record profits.
End belongs to a group of verbs where the same noun can be the subject of the verb or its object
In this sentence, ‘the session’ is the object of end
We will end the session with questions
In this sentence, ‘the session’ is the subject of end
The session will end with questions
end.translation[1].note_box[1].sections[: if a event, activity, or story ends, it stops happening
How does the story end?
The school year ends in June.
finish
to end – use this about an organized event such as a meeting, party, or lesson, especially when saying what time it ends
The meeting will finish at 5.30.
What time does your Spanish class finish?
be over
if an event, activity, or period of time is over, it has ended
I can’t wait for our exams to be over.
The long summer vacation was almost over.
come to an end
to finally end – used about a period of time, a situation, or an activity that has continued for a long time
The war finally came to an end six years later.
draw to an end/to a close
to end gradually over a period of time – used in written descriptions
These problems still remained as the twentieth century drew to an end.
time is up
if time is up, you are not allowed any more time to do something
I wasn’t able to finish the test before the time was up.
time runs out
if time runs out, there is no more time available to do something, especially something important
The desperate search for survivors continues, but time is running out.
expire
if a ticket, bank card, legal document etc expires, the period of time during which you can use it has ended
I’m afraid we can’t accept this credit card – it expired last week.
be at an end
if something is at an end, it has ended
We both knew that our marriage was at an end.
The long wait was at an end.
end.translation[2].definitions[0].defini: a figure that is at the top or bottom end of a range is high or low in the range of possible figures that were expected
end.translation[2].definitions[0].exampl: The results were at the top end of previous market forecasts.
end.translation[2].definitions[1].defini: a product that is at the top or bottom end of a range is the most expensive or cheapest in the range
end.translation[2].definitions[1].exampl: It won’t be easy competing at the top end of the market.
Bombay dealers are the main suppliers of the cheap end of the US diamond jewelry market.
